caption.p: Milestones in cell cultures and microfluidics.

tr.td: Established that a physiological state of the cell similar to the live cell can be maintained even after the death of the organism.
Cell entrapment and frog embryo nerve fiber growth in vitro.
Initiated tissue culture of chick embryo heart cells using embryo extracts as cultural media passaged for a reported period of 34 years.
Grew vaccinia virus in fragments of guinea pig corneal tissue.
Used trypsin to suspend attached cells in culture.
First viral vaccine against chicken pox.
Single-cell culture using microscale glass capillaries
Polio virus grown on human embryonic cells in culture.
Establishment of continuous cell line from a human cervical carcinoma (HeLa cells).
Established nutrient requirements of cells in culture and defined culture media for growth.
HAT (hypoxanthin, aminopterin, thymidine) medium introduced for cell selection.
Studied human fibroblasts (WI-38) and showed finite lifespan in culture.
First hybridoma secreting a monoclonal antibody.
Gas chromatography system using silicon-etched microchannels
Recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) in mammalian cells. Human growth hormone produced from recombinant bacteria was accepted for therapeutic use.
First monoclonal antibody was approved by the FDA for use in humans (Orthoclone OKT3).
Erythropoietin (EPO) recombinant protein produced in CHO cells available commercially.
Manz, Harrison, Verpoorte, Fettinger, Paulus, Ludi, and Widmer
Micro-machined glass chip electrophoresis for separating molecules
First genetically engineered recombinant blood-clotting factor used in the treatment of hemophilia A.
Production of transgenic sheep (Dolly) through nuclear transfer technique.
Hadd, Raymond, Halliwell, Jacobson, and Ramsey
Creation of microfluidic systems using PDMS (polydimethylsiloxane)
Panaro, Yuen, Sakazume, Fortina, Kricka, Wilding
Claimed to produce cloned human baby named EVE.
First antiangiogenic monoclonal antibody that inhibits the growth of blood vessels or angiogenesis (for cancer therapy).
Single-cell culture in open microfluidic systems
Reported antibody titers at an industrial scale of 5 g/L and more.
Combined gene therapy with blood stem cell therapy, which may be a useful tool for treating fatal brain disease.
1 M molecule treatment causes stem cells to turn into precursors of liver cells.
Single-cell and single-molecule proteomics utilizing nanospace technology
First gene therapy successful against aging-associated decline in mice.
